content.description:
This route more closely follows the bolted line and makes use of the lower crimpy crux. Must avoid the left dihedral until the end of the climb. 



Located on the same north facing wall as several other variations and is opposite to popular top rope routes; In the Black, Black Book and Facing the Black. The rock is riddled with good edges and horizontal hand cracks.

Bolted with fixed anchors.

This route more closely follows the bolted line and makes use of the lower crimpy crux. Must avoid the left dihedral completely. Unlike the other two lines, the end features slaby face climbing with no aid from the roof on the left. 


Located on the same north facing wall as several other variations and is opposite to popular top rope routes; In the Black, Black Book and Facing the Black. The rock is riddled with good edges and horizontal hand cracks.

Bolted with shared fixed anchors.

Left most line that follows the easiest weakness in the rock. 



Located on the same north facing wall as several other variations and is opposite to popular top rope routes; In the Black, Black Book and Facing the Black. The rock is riddled with good edges and horizontal hand cracks. 

Bolted with an anchor shared with two other harder variations.

This route features two overhangs, a small slab section, a small traversal and a mantel and starts near the base of a small pine tree that grows out of a small outcropping at the bottom. Alpine draw on bolt five might be handy for reducing rope drag on the overhang. 

First route to the right of easy way down, roughly 10 feet down the path heading south. 
Six bolts with two fixed anchors.

A early small roof protected by a single bolt followed by several horizontal finger and hand cracks. Top out on thin vertical and horizontal finger cracks on a slightly slab face. 



Located roughly twenty feet left of second easy way down, this wall features several closely grouped trad climbs. A small roof with a single bolt will identify the start of this climb. 

One bolt and fixed anchors

Fun mantle to start followed by what initially feels like a blank slabby face. Second bolt can be tricky and exposed. Lost after the fourth bolt? Don't worry the anchor is hidden directly over the top of the ridge and getting there is easier than the previous few bolts.

Starts on the same shelf feature as "Pull Up" but runs left. 
Four bolts and a fixed anchor with rings.

Great first trad lead with easy climbing featuring bomb placements. 



Left most line in the main amphitheater like wall that features many trad climbs towards the far end of the easy way down sector. 

Fixed anchors.

Was a trad route but has unfortunately been bolted despite copious and good protection available. Follows the arête out right before pulling in from under a small roof. Follow a short face climb before traversing a nice horizontal hand crack below the finish. 



Located on the same north facing wall as several other variations and is opposite to popular top rope routes; In the Black, Black Book and Facing the Black. The rock is riddled with good edges and horizontal hand cracks. 

Bolted with fixed anchors, but a very easy trad lead due to good pro.

Slabby start into an awkward dihedral like mantel. 



Located directly right of Tea. Earl Grey. Hot.

Bolted with fixed anchors

Broken corner, then up to the slab.

Stick clip advised for the first bold.



Lefmost route of this section of the wall

5 bolts + anchor

Easy slab start that quickly escalates in difficulty and verticality at the first bolt. Very sustained technical climbing on small crimps featuring traversals following the only weaknesses in the rock. 

Roughly 150 meters left (North) of the second easy way down. Easily identifiable by locating the pine tree growing out of the rock face with an exposed root system. The route starts just to the right of this tree. 
Bolted with fixed anchors

Similar start to Flaky Flake, but follows a vertical finger crack half way up before heading right of a tree near the anchor. 



Second line right from the left most side of the main amphitheater like wall that features many trad climbs towards the far end of the easy way down sector. 

Fixed anchors.

Starts on a nice shelf with an immediate mantle followed by lovely slab with a slight dihedral right.

Starts on the same shelf feature as "Pull Up" but runs right. 
Four bolts and a fixed anchor with rings.

Short slab section that meets at the base of a roof. Follow a short leftward traverse to a bolt protecting the crux. A balancey crux gives way to an easy slab dihedral to the anchors. The anchors are simply two bolts with no rings, walk off or make use of the anchors on "The Next Generation" t the left to lower when cleaning. 



Located on the same propionate feature as "The Next Generation" above a large boulder field.  

Mixed climb with a single crux bolt. Two bolts for the anchor, but no rap rings present.

An easy slabby start leading to a well protected mantle that meets with the dihedral. Well protected and not sustained. 

Bolted with fixed anchors

Upward to the mini-roof



Right of Make It So.

5 bolts + anchor
Many moderates, a few classics and a number of new climbs.  Most climbs have anchors.
